body_html:
@neocxi it's not indeed. If we omit the user-facing and language-level aspects of TC, our positioning is strictly below the graph-level abstraction. TC gives a first reasonable answer to: "I have a subgraph, what is a good implementation of that subgraph on target hardware X".
Our hope is that your favorite graph-level compiler/engine (XLA, NNVM, nGraph, TensorRT, Caffe2, ONNX, ...) starts providing HPC kernel synthesis.
But I'm sure all these aforementioned solutions have something that fits the bill in the works.
